title: How to beat a fed yi as a champ without cc
body:

I don't play ww much, if at all

I just don't think people really give WW enough credit for his 1v1 capability is all. Considering his insane damage reduction, fear, long-term cc on ult that heals him, massive heal from q, and increased attack speed when the target is low

all-in-all, I feel like a yi would lose to ww more times than not (and I play a decent amount of Yi)

Don't get me wrong, WW is a fantastic duelist, the issue is his kit actually has very little damage in it, it all revolves around healing and inate tankyness..
But no amount of tankyness and healing without the proper damage to back it up will ever bet a hyper carry like Yi who is building to duel, the damage is just way to high and Yi's healing late game with ruined king wont be far behind Warwicks.

I feel like this should be tested, because honestly at this point it's all theoretical 

"what *specific* items did they build"

"what point in the game is this" (because I think we can agree, ww beats yi at least until late game)

"*how* fed is yi?"

"just how much healing to damage does each champion have against eachother?"

I saw you make the argument that WW doesn't have the burst to access his steroid by getting Yi low, but I don't think WW *needs* burst. WW has about 3 seconds of *hard cc* just in his kit alone. WW has 3 seconds to lifesteal and whale on Yi all he wants before Yi can auto back, and this is after 2.5 seconds of 55% damage reduction and WW getting 3 free hits + heals + onhit effects (botrk + titanic) from just his ult alone. 

Basically, WW gets 2.5 seconds of damage reduction followed by 5ish autos of healing + onhit effects in which Yi can't do anything in the meantime.

imo, it really just depends on if Yi is able to survive WW's ult at a high enough hp, which also depends on when ww uses it. Idk, I imagine it'd at least be a close fight, but I'm honestly just arguing for the sake of playing out this scenario in our heads.

Nothing, yi is a very simple binary champ that relies on brute force of stats.
He does have counters, but it's either you shut him down, or he shuts your ass down.

> Nothing, yi is a very simple binary champ that relies on brute force of stats.

He isn't that binary as you think he is.

No champion really is, very few are.
But in terms lf outplay potential, he has very few ways to fuck up if he's ahed, and very little room to outplay if behind.
That's not bad, he's a simple chamo for newer people.

>  he has very few ways to fuck up if he's ahed

He has A LOT to fuck up if he is ahead or not. 1 CC can destroy him. He has to time his Q use and his W use. He also has to use W to prevent from getting bursted and for AA reset. He can't walk straight into enemy team and fight. He has to wait until they burn their CC.
He has to use his Q very wisely because it's his only way of avoiding the CC. Engaging fight with Q most likely ends with Yi being dead. Targeted CC pretty much stops him.

There is a reason why he isn't played in higher elo.

> and very little room to outplay if behind.

His Q gives him a lot of potential to outplay.


> That's not bad, he's a simple chamo for newer people.

Except he isn't simple. If you want a simple champ go for Xin.

His Q is his only real outplay tool, all the rest is passives, and his Q isnt very hard to use.

And it doesn't take too few of mechanical skills, He has low to mid skill floor, but very high skill ceilling.

Sadly, this is pretty false. Well, there's a small variety of ways to approach situations and fully develop Yi, in comparison to more wild types of duelists, a fully developed Yi who understand nearly every intricacy could tell you with full confidence there are so many better picks than Master Yi to fulyl master. Yi has about 2 styles to approaching a fight besides using the terrain: Run forward and slice things, or Alpha strike to avoid the CC and hope that the system doesn't decide the CC hits first. The difficulty in these approaches is the equivalent of running at somebody with a knife saying "I'm going to kill you"; not hard at all. Yi is one of the few champions i'd argue has the game's lowest skill ceiling in terms of just outright maximizing his potential. Compare it to {{champion:54}} , a champion who seems very binary but provides a wide variety of tactics to his assault: ulting in, picking off a target with his Q, buying {{item:3025}} and flashing with an E>AA>W>AA, or ulting in, or ulting back to defend his backline. Yi can't really do anything besides his alpha and rushing forward (without ult or not) and slicing. His W is generic sustain which makes his decent in the jungle, and the true damage to rip through ganks so his gimmick of slicing up targets works against almost all targets. Why use Yi when you could use {{champion:19}}, a champion with an equally low skill floor, but ridiculous skill ceiling with so many ways to approach ganks, be tanky while dealing damage, hunt down targets, provide tankiness or damage, or a variety of clearing and pathing. 

To agree Jack, Yi's pretty binary. He doesn't have a lot to f*ck up besides his autoattacks, managing his alpha, and... that's about it. Positioning and prediction rely more on general game knowledge, something Yi introduces at a minimum for early on players until they can access and try difficult or different characters. TL;DR: You're making Yi seem much more complex than he really is.

how to beat him:

Learn not to feed a hypercarry without any CC.

1. Don't feed him
2. Build armor
3. Focus him in teamfights, he doesn't teamfight well if he's only equal or behind.
4. PICK SOME DAMN CC IN YOUR COMP JFC who goes into champion select and thinks "Zed top, Katarina Mid, Jinx Jungle, Ezreal ADC, Nidalee support" It's really hard NOT to have a single lockdown spell on your team.
Reliable CC*.

I don't know.

No CC is just asking to lose in general TBH !
Win the game before he scales.
Ninja Tabi and Randuin's Omen are basically your only options. Don't fight him if he's using his ult.

Yi is kind of one of those champs that you either:
1. Need CC
or
2. Need to prevent from getting ahead.

There's some others like that such as Vayne, Tryndamere, etc.  Just know the champs and know what they require.  Play accordingly.  Why isn't Yi or Trynd common at the pro levels?  Because pros know to do numbers 1 and 2 above and can easily deal with them or end the game before they become relevant.

You also need to pick up champions with CC if you do anything other than only play ADC.  You can't always play squishy carries with no CC and expect your team to bring the tank and CC.
